result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A. Robl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500)

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary A. Robl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on June 24, 2016

Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Zachary A. Robl in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation agent is also present.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-120, 15CM-425, 16CF-96, 15CF-395 and 15CT-162.

9:08 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Defendant previously entered pleas, Court ordered a PSI. One was prepared and copies were forwarded to counsel.
State has complied with victim notification statutes. Ms. Firkus has a statement to present. State has corrections from a factual standpoing in the PSI, states this for the record. State moves to remove the domestic abuse repeater enhancer in 16CF-96 in Ct 2 and Ct 3. Maximum penalties are addressed. Atty Halverson concurs. Court questions Defendant regarding pleas in these two counts. Defendant understands, is willing to go forward.

Court addresses the recommendations in the PSI report on Page 32. Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding some component of extended supervision.

Atty Halverson has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty Halverson states Defendant's mother may make a statement. Court clarifies only victims can make a statement but she may testify.  Atty Halverson replies.  

9:18 AM Dawn Crawford is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Halverson.
9:24 AM Cross-examination by Atty Molepske.

9:26 AM M. Firkus has a statement, Atty Molepske reads the statement into the record.

9:29 AM State makes sentencing recommendations. 

9:50 AM Atty Halverson makes sentencing recommendations, 130 days credit on 16CF-96. 15CF-395 has 105 days credit as well.

State addresses bond.

10:05 AM Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

10:06 AM Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court believes PSI is thorough and complete.

15CF-395:
Ct 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence of 3 yrs 6 mo
Initial Confinement of 1 yr 6 mo
Extended Supervision of 2 yrs
0 Days Credit
Conditions:
Any contact with Melanie Firkus needs to be pre-approved by agent prior to contact, then no violent or abusive contact with Melanie Firkus
No Contact with Richard Christensen and/or No Contact with Richard Sodke
No Contact with BMO Harris Bank, do not be on premises of any BMO Harris Bank
Complete and comply with counseling related to anger management and domestic abuse as well as AODA aftercare treatment
Complete a parenting class 
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Sign releases of information for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies/treatment
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and DOC
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Pay court costs out of prison account at rate of 25%, balance to be paid on extended supervision
Pay v/w surcharge
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample if not done so

Ct 2:
Jail sentence for 9 Months concurrent to Ct 1
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 3:
Jail sentence for 9 months concurrent to Ct 1 and Ct 2
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 4:
Jail sentence for 9 months concurrent to Ct 1 and Ct 2 and Ct 3
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

16CF-96:
Ct 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence of 4 yrs consecutive to 15CF-395
Initial Confinement of 2 yrs
Extended Supervision of 2 yrs
130 days credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-395
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 3:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to Ct 2, consecutive to 15CF-395 
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 4:
Determinate Prison Sentence of 3  yrs, concurrent to Ct 2 and Ct 3,  consecutive to 15CF-395
Initial Confinement of 1 yr 6 mo
Extended Supervision of 1 yr 6 mo
Conditions:
Comply with condition as stated in Ct 2 and 15CF-395
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 5:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to Ct 2 and Ct 3 and  Ct 4, consecutive to 15CF-395
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 10:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to Ct 2 and Ct 3 and Ct 4 and Ct 5, consecutive to 15CF-395
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Ct 11:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to Ct 2 and Ct 3 and Ct 4 and Ct 5 and Ct 10, consecutive to 15CF-395
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

15CM-120:
Ct 1:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to 15CF-395
105 Days Credit
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

15CM-425:
Ct 1:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to 15CF-395
0 Days Credit
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

15CT-162:
Ct 1:
Jail sentence for  105  Days, concurrent to 15CF-395
105 Days credit
Pay court costs 
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA surcharge

Written explanation of determinate sentence is addressed. 
Parties will keep their copies of the PSI report. 
20 days in which to appeal or seek postconviction relief
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on May 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on May 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-395, 15CM-120, 15CM-475, 15CT-162 and 15CM-425.

3:39 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea hearing today.

15CM-120: Defendant will plead to Count 1
15CT-162: Defendant will plead to charge 
15CF-395: State will dismissed and read in Count 1. Defendant will plead to Count 2 and 3 and 4
15CM-425: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in. 
15CM-475: Will be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes

Victim notice has been made and Ms. Firkus is in the courtroom.
Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM-120: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CT-162: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-425: Count 1: NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-120: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CT-162: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-395: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 4: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-425: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-425: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-475: Dismissed and Read In

Due to time constraints, these cases will be adjourned for sentencing at another date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Zachary A. Robl not in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM120, 15CT162

Atty Molepske statements to the Court.  Defendant has new charges.  Atty Renc handles these files.  Waiting on the status of the new files and these will track.

BTC: Bond $500.00 cash bond to cover 15CM120 with same conditions.
No contact with  Scott Szerlong.    Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks.

1:18 p.m. Defendant Zachary A. Robl appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CT162 for return on warrant -initial and 15CM120 Return on Warrant. Court questions Defendant to reasons for missing court.

15CT162 - Initial Appearance:   Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
P/NG entered.
Both cases should be assigned to Br 3. 
Warrants quashed.
BTC: Bond $500.00 cash bond to cover 15CM120 with same conditions.
BTC: 15CT162: $100 cash bond:   Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Zachary A. Robl not in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:22 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Molepske makes statements. Hearing date was written and given to the defendant at the pre-trial. 
BY THE COURT:  Court finds notice was sent and not returned.  Bench warrant.  $500 cash alternative.
$2,000 sig bond: No contact with  Scott Szerlong.    Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks.

Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
P/NG entered.
BTC:  $2,000 sig bond: No contact with  Scott Szerlong.    Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:45 am.
